alert.note: Alert for Henry; Jefferson; Keokuk; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 2:20AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Henry, western Louisa, southeastern Keokuk, Washington, southwestern Muscatine and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 220 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Brighton, or 10 miles west of Washington, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Washington, Columbus Junction, Winfield, Wayland, Brighton, Richland, Ainsworth, Conesville, Columbus City, Crawfordsville, Olds, Cotter, Coppock, Wyman, Keota, Fredonia, West Chester, Washington Airport, Haskins and Lake Darling State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Henry; Jefferson; Keokuk; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington
